items.name: addressing-law-no-2014-78.md
items.title: Addressing (By-law No. 2014–78) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law outlines regulations for naming private roads and highways, numbering buildings and lots, and the installation and maintenance of associated signage, including provisions for applications, administration, public notice, enforcement, and fees.

items.name: amended-heritage-community-improvement-plan-law-no-2024-176.md
items.title: Amended Heritage Community Improvement Plan (By-law No. 2024-176) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The Amended Heritage Community Improvement Plan, adopted on May 1, 2024, repeals the previous 2020 plan and aims to encourage the restoration, rehabilitation, and integration of designated heritage buildings through a Tax Increment Equivalent Grant (TIEG) program, offering up to 75% of the municipal tax increment for up to 10 years or a maximum of $500,000, provided projects meet specific criteria such as demonstrating high standards of heritage conservation, increasing housing units, creating a tax uplift, and not receiving concurrent funding from certain other programs, with applications requiring pre-consultation, a heritage permit submission, and an independent tax study, and grants being contingent on project completion, property reassessment, and annual budget approval.

items.name: amended-integrated-orleans-community-improvement-plan-law-no-2024-173.md
items.title: Amended Integrated Orléans Community Improvement Plan (By-law No. 2024-173) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The Integrated Orléans Community Improvement Plan (CIP) aims to stimulate private investment, foster economic growth, and enhance the community through various incentive programs, including the St. Joseph Boulevard Main Street Program, the Employment Creation Incentive Program, and the Pedestrian Friendly Streets Program, all designed to encourage redevelopment, job creation, and improved urban aesthetics, particularly in areas impacted by the new LRT extension.

items.name: amended-montreal-road-community-improvement-plan-law-no-2024-174.md
items.title: Amended Montreal Road Community Improvement Plan (By-law No. 2024-174) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The Amended Montreal Road Community Improvement Plan aims to stimulate economic development, urban renewal, and property upgrades along Montreal Road, particularly in the Vanier commercial thoroughfare, by offering a Tax Increment Equivalent Grant (TIEG) to eligible property owners undertaking redevelopment projects, with additional supplementary benefits for projects supporting cultural activities, artists, and social enterprises within the Quartier Vanier District, all contingent on Council approval, adherence to specific criteria, and a demonstrated need for the incentive to spur development.

items.name: animal-care-and-control-law-no-2003-077.md
items.title: Animal Care and Control (By-law No. 2003-077) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations for animal care and control, including requirements for leashing, pet limits, registration, waste removal, impoundment procedures, vicious dog protocols, rabies immunization, and restrictions on livestock, pigeons, rabbits, and prohibited animals, along with enforcement details and repeal of previous regulations.

items.name: appendix-b-amendment-schedule-zoning-law-and-interim-control-laws-law-no-2022-232.md
items.title: Appendix B - Amendment Schedule to the Zoning By-law and Interim Control By-laws (By-law No. 2022-232) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This appendix provides a regularly updated, descending numerical list of amending by-laws to the Zoning By-law, including affected lands, enactment dates with links to council meeting details and reports, status, and related by-law information, with copies available at specified locations and a note that this appendix is for reference and the amendments are incorporated into the main by-law text, schedules, and map upon becoming fully in effect.

items.name: appendix-b-amendment-schedule-zoning-law-and-interim-control-laws-law-no-2022-232%2F2010-2007.md
items.title: 2010-2007 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a record of amendments and repeals to By-law 2008-250, detailing the specific properties, sections, exceptions, and schedules affected, the date of enactment, the current status, relevant OMB Order information, and which other by-laws were repealed or amended.

items.name: appendix-b-amendment-schedule-zoning-law-and-interim-control-laws-law-no-2022-232%2F2014-2011.md
items.title: 2014-2011 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document details various amendments and exceptions to a zoning by-law, affecting numerous properties and areas, including changes related to residential conversions, secondary dwelling units, flood plain mapping, transit-oriented development plans, and technical corrections, with some amendments subject to appeals or repealed by subsequent by-laws.

items.name: appendix-b-amendment-schedule-zoning-law-and-interim-control-laws-law-no-2022-232%2F2018-2015.md
items.title: 2018-2015 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text is a list of enacted by-laws, detailing the affected properties or sections, the date of enactment, their current status (In Effect, Repealed, or Appeals Received), any relevant OMB Order information, and whether they repeal or amend other by-laws.

items.name: appendix-b-amendment-schedule-zoning-law-and-interim-control-laws-law-no-2022-232%2F2022-2019.md
items.title: 2022-2019 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text is a list of zoning changes and holding symbol removals for various properties, along with amendments to the Official Plan and zoning provisions, all enacted by council between January 2019 and December 2022, with most changes amending By-law 2008-250.

items.name: atv-orv-and-snowmobile-law-no-2019-421.md
items.title: ATV, ORV and Snowmobile (By-law No. 2019-421) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law regulates the operation of All-Terrain Vehicles (ATVs), Multi-Purpose Off-Highway Utility Vehicles, Recreational Off-Highway Vehicles, and Motorized Snow Vehicles on specific designated highways and unopened road allowances, outlining definitions, permitted areas, application processes for new and expanded trail networks, general operating regulations including speed limits and hours, membership requirements for operators, restrictions on vehicle modifications and use in natural areas, and enforcement provisions with associated penalties.

items.name: auditor-general-law-no-2021-5.md
items.title: Auditor General (By-law No. 2021-5) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the establishment, appointment, duties, accountability, responsibilities, reporting structure, and operational framework for the Auditor General, including their independence, audit scope (excluding attest functions and policy merits), investigation of fraud and waste, access to information, budget, and confidentiality, while also repealing a previous related regulation.

items.name: bilingualism-law-no-2001-170.md
items.title: Bilingualism (By-law No. 2001-170) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This enactment establishes the right of citizens to communicate and receive services in both English and French, in accordance with a previously adopted policy, while ensuring no employee loses their job and implementation is done in consultation with collective bargaining groups.

items.name: board-law-no-2010-211.md
items.title: Board Up (By-law No. 2010-211) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations requiring owners of vacant or damaged buildings with accessible openings to board them up, detailing the process for notification, enforcement, and cost recovery if the owner fails to comply.

items.name: boards-management-business-improvement-areas-law-no-2021-255.md
items.title: Boards of Management for Business Improvement Areas (By-law No. 2021-255) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines standardized governance for Business Improvement Area (BIA) Boards of Management, covering their application, composition, roles, responsibilities, officers, committees, the role of an Executive Director, by-laws, accountability, transparency, confidentiality, conflict of interest, standard of care, meetings, annual reporting, financial requirements, signing authority, insurance, head office location, membership eligibility, policy requirements, records management, review mechanisms, dissolution procedures, and conflict resolution, applying to the listed BIAs.

items.name: borrowing-upon-30-year-sinking-fund-debentures-law-no-2017-355.md
items.title: Borrowing upon 30 year sinking fund debentures (By-law No. 2017-355) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text authorizes the borrowing of $102,000,000.00 through 30-year sinking fund debentures to finance a capital work related to transportation services, specifically the Stage 2 LRT project including the purchase of Alstom Citadis vehicles, expansion of the Belfast Maintenance and Storage Facility, and provision of train control and communications equipment, outlining the terms of the debentures, including interest payments, sinking fund contributions, registration, transfer, and payment procedures.

items.name: borrowing-upon-additional-sinking-fund-debentures-200000000-law-no-2019-272.md
items.title: Borrowing upon additional sinking fund debentures $200,000,000 (By-law No. 2019-272) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document authorizes the borrowing of $200,000,000 through the issuance of additional sinking fund debentures to finance certain capital works, specifically related to the Light Rail Transit project, and outlines the terms and conditions of these debentures, including interest payments, sinking fund contributions, registration, transfer, and substitution procedures.

items.name: borrowing-upon-additional-sinking-fund-debentures-225000000-law-no-2021-359.md
items.title: Borrowing upon additional sinking fund debentures $225,000,000 (By-law No. 2021-359) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document authorizes the borrowing of $225,000,000 through the issuance of additional sinking fund debentures to fund a capital work, specifically related to the Light Rail Transit Stage 2 and Confederation Line projects, with these debentures being part of a larger series of green debentures and subject to specific terms regarding interest payments, sinking fund contributions, registration, transfer, and other conditions.

items.name: borrowing-upon-sinking-fund-debentures-200000000-law-no-2022-166.md
items.title: Borrowing upon sinking fund debentures $200,000,000 (By-law No. 2022-166) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document authorizes the borrowing of $200,000,000 through sinking fund debentures to finance light rail transit capital works, outlining the terms of the debentures, including interest payments, sinking fund contributions, registration, transfer, and other related administrative procedures, all in accordance with the Green Debenture Framework and relevant legislation.

items.name: borrowing-upon-sinking-fund-debentures-300000000-law-no-2020-110.md
items.title: Borrowing upon sinking fund debentures $300,000,000 (By-law No. 2020-110) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document authorizes the issuance of $300,000,000.00 in sinking fund debentures to finance a capital work, specifically the Stage 2 Light Rail Transit project, outlining the terms of the debentures including interest rate, maturity date, payment schedule, registration, transfer, and other related conditions.

items.name: building-law-no-2014-220.md
items.title: Building (By-law No. 2014-220) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations and procedures for building permits, including application requirements, fees, inspections, and enforcement, covering construction, demolition, and changes of use for various building types.

items.name: city-manager-law-no-2025-68.md
items.title: City Manager (By-law No. 2025-68) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text establishes the position and duties of the City Manager as the Chief Administrative Officer, responsible for the general control and management of the municipality's affairs, supervision of administration, officers, and employees, accountability to Council for delegated powers and functions, and outlines the process for appointment, dismissal, or revocation of the City Manager, including the potential for delegation of this responsibility to Council requiring a two-thirds majority vote for such actions.

items.name: clothing-donation-box-law-no-2023-425.md
items.title: Clothing Donation Box (By-law No. 2023–425) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations for clothing donation boxes, including permitting requirements for owners and operators, rules for placement and maintenance of the boxes, enforcement procedures, penalties for non-compliance, and a process for allocating locations on municipal property.

items.name: code-conduct-members-council-law-no-2025-99.md
items.title: Code of Conduct for Members of Council (By-law No. 2025-99) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document establishes a code of conduct for elected officials, outlining their responsibilities regarding integrity, confidentiality, meeting conduct, discrimination, use of influence and resources, interactions with staff, expenses, lobbying, gifts, and election-related activities, and details the process for addressing complaints and potential sanctions for violations.

items.name: code-conduct-members-local-boards-law-no-2018-399.md
items.title: Code of Conduct for Members of Local Boards (By-law No. 2018-399) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the code of conduct for members of local boards, detailing expectations for integrity, confidentiality, conduct at meetings, non-discrimination, proper use of influence and resources, interactions with staff, handling of gifts, election-related activities, outside activities, communications with adjudicative boards, and the independent nature of adjudicative boards, along with procedures for informal and formal complaints, investigation processes, and potential sanctions for non-compliance, including reporting to the local board and/or Council.

items.name: code-conduct-public-members-built-heritage-committee-law-no-2025-77.md
items.title: Code of Conduct for Public Members of the Built Heritage Committee (By-law No. 2025-77) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document establishes a code of conduct for public members of the Built Heritage Committee, outlining their responsibilities regarding integrity, confidentiality, meeting conduct, discrimination and harassment, use of influence and resources, interactions with staff, conflict of interest, lobbying, gifts, and election-related activity, and details the process for addressing complaints and potential sanctions.

items.name: community-benefits-charge-law-law-no-2022-307.md
items.title: Community Benefits Charge By-law (By-law No. 2022-307) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law establishes a community benefits charge on certain residential and mixed-use developments and redevelopments of five or more storeys with ten or more residential units to fund capital costs for facilities and services required due to growth, with the charge being 4% of the land value, payable before a building permit is issued, subject to exemptions, credits, and provisions for in-kind contributions and payment arrangements, and with disputes regarding land valuation handled according to the Planning Act.

items.name: community-safety-zone-law-no-2019-397.md
items.title: Community Safety Zone (By-law No. 2019-397) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: Designation of community safety zones on various roads with associated speed limits and school proximity.

items.name: compliance-reports-law-no-2003-069.md
items.title: Compliance Reports (By-law No. 2003-069) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the types of compliance reports available from the Development Services Department, including Summary, Zoning, Pool Enclosure, Agreement, Release of Agreement, and Rooming House reports, detailing the information provided in each and the associated fees listed in Schedule A.

items.name: contribution-rebate-program-law-no-2022-76.md
items.title: Contribution Rebate Program (By-law No. 2022-76) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines a program authorizing rebates for individuals contributing to eligible municipal council candidates, detailing eligibility requirements for both contributors and candidates, the application process, rebate calculation, and the repeal of previous related regulations.

items.name: delegation-authority-law-no-2025-69.md
items.title: Delegation of Authority (By-law No. 2025-69) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the delegation of authority from the City Council to various officers and departments, including the City Manager, Chief Financial Officer/Treasurer, City Clerk, General Managers of Community and Social Services, Recreation, Cultural and Facility Services, Emergency and Protective Services, Transit Services, Infrastructure and Water Services, Planning, Development and Building Services, Public Works, and Strategic Initiatives, as well as the City Solicitor, detailing their specific responsibilities and the types of agreements, approvals, and actions they are authorized to undertake, often with reporting requirements to relevant Standing Committees or Council.

items.name: demolition-control-law-no-2012-377.md
items.title: Demolition Control (By-law No. 2012-377) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text establishes an area where demolition of residential properties is controlled, requiring a permit unless specific exceptions apply, outlining the process for obtaining such permits and penalties for non-compliance, and repealing a previous regulation on the same subject.

items.name: deputy-mayors-law-no-2023-11.md
items.title: Deputy Mayors (By-law No. 2023-11) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines the appointment of Councillors to serve as Deputy Mayors, acting in the Mayor's place when absent or the office is vacant, with the authority to exercise the Mayor's powers and duties, and repeals a previous by-law on the same subject.

items.name: discharge-firearms-law-no-2002-344.md
items.title: Discharge of Firearms (By-law No. 2002-344) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations regarding the discharge of firearms, including definitions of terms, prohibited areas for discharge (both shaded map areas and unshaded areas with specific restrictions), exceptions to the regulations for certain individuals and activities, penalties for contravention, enforcement procedures, and the repeal of previous related regulations.

items.name: e-scooters-law-no-2020-174.md
items.title: E-scooters (By-law No. 2020 - 174) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law regulates the operation and use of electric kick scooters, defining them as two-wheeled vehicles with a platform, handlebars, and an electric motor not exceeding 500 watts with a maximum speed of 24 km/h, outlining where they can and cannot be operated, general regulations including age limits, helmet requirements for minors, and restrictions on carrying passengers or cargo, safe operation guidelines such as maintaining distance from pedestrians and having a bell and lights, provisions for removal and impounding of improperly parked scooters with associated fees and disposal procedures, the authority of the Chief of Police to erect signs, and penalties for contraventions.

items.name: encroachments-city-highways-law-no-2003-446.md
items.title: Encroachments on City Highways (By-law No. 2003-446) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations and fees for various types of encroachments on public highways, including definitions, permit requirements, application procedures, general regulations for permanent and temporary encroachments like canopies, sub-surface structures, tourist information kiosks, waste receptacles, Christmas decorations, and customer service boxes, as well as provisions for revocation, enforcement, penalties, and exemptions.

items.name: fence-law-no-2003-462.md
items.title: Fence (By-law No. 2003-462) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations regarding the erection, height, and maintenance of fences, including definitions of relevant terms, height restrictions for different property types and locations, construction and material standards, maintenance requirements, prohibited fence types, and enforcement provisions.

items.name: film-law-law-no-2020-164.md
items.title: Film By-law (By-law No. 2020-164) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines the regulations and requirements for obtaining a permit to conduct filming events on public and private property, including application procedures, timelines, fees, insurance, responsibilities of permit holders, enforcement, and penalties.

items.name: fire-routes-law-no-2003-499.md
items.title: Fire Routes (By-law No. 2003-499) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations for designating and maintaining fire routes, including requirements for signs, parking restrictions, enforcement, and penalties for violations.

items.name: fire-routes-law-no-2003-499%2Fschedule-fire-routes.md
items.title: Schedule A – Fire Routes | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a comprehensive consolidation of the Fire Routes By-law (By-law 2003-499), incorporating numerous amendments from 2004 to 2025, and lists over 1500 designated fire routes with their corresponding street address numbers and street names.

items.name: fireworks-law-no-2003-237.md
items.title: Fireworks (By-law No. 2003-237) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations regarding the sale and discharge of fireworks, prohibiting firecrackers and certain other types, restricting the sale of consumer fireworks to specific days around Victoria Day and Canada Day, limiting the discharge of consumer fireworks to those same periods plus the day before and after, requiring permits for display and special effect fireworks with detailed application procedures and conditions including insurance and indemnification, and repealing previous municipal regulations on the subject.

items.name: graffiti-management-law-no-2008-01.md
items.title: Graffiti Management (By-law No. 2008-01) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations prohibiting the placement of graffiti on property and requiring property owners to keep their property free of graffiti, defining terms like "graffiti" and "owner," detailing procedures for issuing notices to comply and the consequences of failure to do so, including the city's right to remove the graffiti and recover costs, and specifying offenses, penalties, and certain exemptions.

items.name: heat-law-no-2010-210.md
items.title: Heat (By-law No. 2010-210) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations requiring landlords to maintain specific minimum temperatures in rented dwelling accommodations, defines adequate heat, outlines procedures for addressing non-compliance including issuing notices, allowing entry for necessary work, recovering costs, and imposing penalties for violations.

items.name: idling-control-law-no-2024-437.md
items.title: Idling Control (By-law No. 2024-437) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This regulation governs vehicle idling, defining terms like "idle," "vehicle," and "owner," establishing time limits for idling based on occupancy and temperature, outlining exceptions for certain vehicles and situations, detailing enforcement procedures by By-law Officers, and specifying penalties for violations, including fines and potential court orders, while also repealing a previous regulation and setting an effective date.

items.name: information-and-materials-planning-applications-law-no-2023-297.md
items.title: Information and Materials for Planning Applications (By-law No. 2023-297) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the required and potentially required information and materials for various planning applications, including Official Plan amendments, Zoning By-law amendments, draft Plan of Subdivision approvals, Condominium approvals, Site Plan Control applications, and Urban and Village Boundary Expansion Official Plan amendments, listing a comprehensive set of potential studies, plans, and reports that may be needed to support the review process.

items.name: integrated-orleans-community-improvement-plan-law-no-2021-284.md
items.title: Integrated Orléans Community Improvement Plan (By-law No. 2021-284) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines the designation of the Integrated Orléans Community Improvement Plan Project Area, repealing previous designations for the St. Joseph Boulevard and Orléans areas.

items.name: integrity-commissioner-law-no-2021-7.md
items.title: Integrity Commissioner (By-law No. 2021-7) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text establishes the position of an Integrity Commissioner, outlining their appointment process, independence, reporting structure, and responsibilities, which include acting as the Lobbyist Registrar and Meetings Investigator, with provisions for access to information, annual reporting, confidentiality, immunity from testimony, and indemnity.

items.name: licensing-law-no-2002-189.md
items.title: Licensing (By-law No. 2002-189) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a comprehensive by-law outlining the licensing, regulation, and governance of various businesses, including auctioneers, driving schools, public garages, snow plow contractors, amusement places, adult entertainment establishments, food premises, exotic animal events, second-hand goods shops, salvage yards, rickshaws, markets, temporary sign lessors, mobile refreshment vendors, rooming houses, pet shops, private parking enforcement agencies, kennels, and payday loan establishments, detailing application procedures, fees, license periods, inspections, transfers, refusals, suspensions, revocations, and penalties, and including definitions for terms used throughout the by-law.

items.name: licensing-law-no-2002-189%2Fbusinesses-regulated-licensing-law-no-2002-189.md
items.title: Businesses Regulated by Licensing (By-law No. 2002-189) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations for various businesses requiring licenses, including auctioneers, driving schools, public garages, snow plow contractors, amusement places, exotic animal entertainment events, exotic animal rescue and education establishments, adult entertainment parlours, tobacco and vapour product retailers, rickshaw operators, second-hand goods shops, salvage yards, exhibitions, flea markets, temporary sign lessors, adult entertainment stores, body-rub parlours, itinerant sellers, mobile refreshment vehicles, mobile canteens, mobile refreshment carts, refreshment stands, rooming houses, rural itinerant sellers, rural refreshment businesses, boarding kennels, in-home breeding kennels, recreational kennels, and payday loan establishments, detailing conditions for issuance and renewal, general operating regulations, insurance and indemnification requirements, and transferability rules.

items.name: light-rail-regulatory-monitor-and-compliance-officer-and-lrt-regulation-law-no-2015-301.md
items.title: Light Rail Regulatory Monitor and Compliance Officer and LRT Regulation (By-law No. 2015-301) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document establishes the position and duties of the Light Rail Regulatory Monitor and Compliance Officer and outlines the regulatory framework for municipal light rail systems, including the Confederation Line, covering aspects like design, construction, operation, safety, security, rates, and conditions of service, and details the officer's responsibilities, reporting structure, and access to information, while also addressing accident investigations and the effective date of the regulations.

items.name: lobbyist-registry-law-no-2012-309.md
items.title: Lobbyist Registry (By-law No. 2012-309) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the regulations for lobbying, establishing a registry and the role of a registrar to oversee lobbying activities, including definitions of key terms, exemptions, prohibited activities like contingency fees, registration requirements, post-employment restrictions for former public office holders, the appointment and responsibilities of the registrar, procedures for addressing non-compliance including potential bans, removal from the registry, referral of matters to appropriate authorities, and a code of conduct for lobbyists covering honesty, openness, disclosure, information handling, competing interests, and avoiding improper influence, along with a process for handling complaints and investigations.

items.name: low-speed-vehicles-law-no-2022-276.md
items.title: Low-Speed Vehicles (By-law No. 2022-276) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for the operation and use of low-speed vehicles, including definitions, operational requirements, speed limits, passenger restrictions, equipment mandates, insurance requirements, driver licensing, parking rules, and enforcement provisions, all subject to provincial regulations and expiring on June 29, 2027.

items.name: marijuana-grow-operation-remediation-law-no-2012-402.md
items.title: Marijuana Grow Operation Remediation (By-law No. 2012–402) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations regarding properties used for marijuana grow operations, including their prohibition, required inspections, remediation procedures under the direction of a professional engineer, the process for issuing orders and certificates of compliance, cost recovery for non-compliance, applicable fees, and enforcement provisions with associated penalties.

items.name: montreal-road-community-improvement-plan-area-law-no-2019-213.md
items.title: Montreal Road Community Improvement Plan Area (By-law No. 2019-213) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text designates a specific area, as shown in Schedule "A", as the Montreal Road Community Improvement Plan Area, following recommendations from the Finance and Economic Development Committee and approval by Council.

items.name: municipal-accommodation-tax-law-no-2022-56.md
items.title: Municipal Accommodation Tax (By-law No. 2022-56) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the regulations for a five percent tax on temporary accommodations of less than 30 nights, including hotels, motels, inns, bed and breakfasts, resorts, hostels, dwelling units, and short-term rentals, detailing collection procedures, exemptions, penalties for non-compliance, and the process for audits and assessments.

items.name: noise-law-no-2017-255.md
items.title: Noise (By-law No. 2017-255) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations regarding noise levels and disturbances, including prohibitions on excessive noise from various sources like sound reproduction devices, power equipment, vehicles, and construction, with specific time restrictions and exemptions for certain activities and events, along with definitions, enforcement procedures, penalties, and provisions for obtaining noise exemptions.

items.name: notices-and-other-communications-during-postal-service-interruption-law-no-2018-306.md
items.title: Notices and other communications during a postal service interruption (By-law No. 2018-306) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines temporary alternative methods for sending and receiving required notices and communications during a postal service interruption, including personal delivery, leaving documents at an address, and electronic transmission, with specific provisions for notices from and to the City, and an exclusion for notices required by the Official Plan, taking effect upon declaration of a postal service interruption and ceasing when it ends.

items.name: open-air-fire-law-no-2004-163.md
items.title: Open Air Fire (By-law No. 2004-163) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations for setting open air fires, including permit requirements, prohibited areas, safety distances, definitions of fire types, and penalties for non-compliance.

items.name: ottawa-mural-law-no-2022-304.md
items.title: Ottawa Mural (By-law No. 2022-304) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for murals, including definitions, permit requirements, application procedures, review processes, conditions for permit issuance and revocation, restrictions on content and placement, maintenance standards, enforcement mechanisms, and penalties for non-compliance.

items.name: parkland-dedication-law-no-2022-280.md
items.title: Parkland Dedication (By-law No. 2022-280) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law repeals and replaces the previous Parkland Dedication By-law, outlining requirements for land dedication or cash-in-lieu for park purposes as a condition of development or redevelopment, defining relevant terms, establishing calculation methods based on development type and density, outlining exceptions and exemptions, detailing the administration and use of collected funds, and providing transition provisions for existing applications.

items.name: parks-and-facilities-law-no-2004-276.md
items.title: Parks and Facilities (By-law No. 2004-276) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for the use of parks and facilities, including hours of operation, prohibited activities such as littering, disturbing wildlife, and using motorized vehicles (with exceptions), smoking restrictions, and requirements for leashing dogs, along with definitions of terms, permit requirements, rules regarding property, animals, sports, vehicles, commercial activities, and behavior, and provisions for enforcement and penalties.

items.name: permanent-signs-private-property-law-no-2016-326.md
items.title: Permanent Signs on Private Property (By-law No. 2016-326) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for permanent signs on private property, including definitions of sign types and related terms, permit requirements and exemptions, procedures for permit applications, lapses, and revocations, rules for encroachment permits, provisions for minor variances, fee structures and refunds, general sign provisions, prohibited signs, maintenance and operation standards, public safety requirements, illumination restrictions, sign face area calculations, specific regulations for ground signs, wall signs, logo signs, mural signs, projecting signs, canopy signs, billboards (static and digital), development signs, directional development signs, and other directional signs, special sign district regulations for Lansdowne, the Palladium Site, and the Parliamentary Precinct/Confederation Boulevard/Rideau Canal area, enforcement procedures, penalties for contraventions, and the repeal of a previous by-law.

items.name: pool-enclosure-law-no-2013-39.md
items.title: Pool Enclosure (By-law No. 2013-39) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for privately-owned outdoor pool enclosures, including definitions, permit requirements, construction specifications for various enclosure types (chain link, vertical board, wrought iron/aluminum/vinyl), specific rules for above-ground pools and hot tubs, provisions for temporary enclosures, compliance procedures, enforcement orders, service of orders, cost recovery, and penalties for contravention.

items.name: private-approach-law-no-2003-447.md
items.title: Private Approach (By-law No. 2003-447) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for the construction, alteration, relocation, and closure of private approaches, including definitions, permit requirements, general regulations, design standards for different property types (commercial, industrial, residential, and rural), temporary approaches, inspection procedures, enforcement through orders and remedial action, and penalties for contravention.

items.name: procedure-law-no-2022-410.md
items.title: Procedure (By-law No. 2022-410) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the rules and procedures governing the meetings and operations of the Council and its Committees and Commissions, including rules for meeting times, locations, public access, conduct of members, voting procedures, agenda preparation, handling of motions and reports, committee structures, and the process for electing the Nominating Committee.

items.name: procurement-law-no-2000-50.md
items.title: Procurement (By-law No. 2000-50) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the procedures and regulations for purchasing goods, services, and construction, aiming for best value and equitable treatment of suppliers through competitive processes, with provisions for various procurement methods, contract management, supplier performance, and reporting.

items.name: property-maintenance-law-no-2005-208.md
items.title: Property Maintenance (By-law No. 2005-208) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for property maintenance, including the removal of refuse and debris, clearing of land, snow and ice removal from roofs and surrounding areas, proper grading for drainage, storage of materials, garbage disposal, and the maintenance of naturalized areas, with provisions for enforcement and penalties for non-compliance.

items.name: property-standards-law-no-2013-416.md
items.title: Property Standards (By-law No. 2013-416) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a consolidated by-law outlining property standards for residential, non-residential, vacant buildings and lands, open spaces, and heritage properties, covering maintenance, repair, safety, cleanliness, and occupancy standards, with provisions for enforcement, appeals, and penalties.

items.name: remembrance-day-law-no-2008-355.md
items.title: Remembrance Day (By-law No. 2008-355) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations requiring most retail businesses to close until 12:30 pm on Remembrance Day, with specific exemptions based on business type, size, and goods sold, and details enforcement and penalties for non-compliance.

items.name: rental-housing-property-management-law-no-2020-255.md
items.title: Rental Housing Property Management (By-law No. 2020-255) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law establishes regulations for the management of residential rental properties, including requirements for capital maintenance plans for apartment buildings, procedures for managing tenant service requests with specific response times for urgent and non-urgent issues, mandatory provision of tenant information covering contact details, service request instructions, fire safety, property maintenance, waste management, parking, and the tenant support registry, the establishment and maintenance of a tenant support registry for voluntary self-identification of assistance needs, the implementation of integrated pest management plans with specific requirements for inspections, tenant education, reporting, treatment plans, and re-inspections, and outlines enforcement provisions, including inspections, penalties for contraventions, and exemptions for certain types of housing.

items.name: residential-protective-plumbing-law-no-2025-89.md
items.title: Residential Protective Plumbing (By-law No. 2025-89) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines a program offering rebates for residential property owners who install protective plumbing devices like backwater valves and sump pumps to prevent basement flooding from sewer backups, detailing eligibility requirements, application procedures, rebate amounts, and conditions for approval or denial, while also repealing a previous by-law.

items.name: right-entry-law-no-2005-326.md
items.title: Right of Entry (By-law No. 2005-326) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the process and requirements for obtaining a Right of Entry Permit to access adjoining land for necessary repairs or alterations to buildings, fences, or other structures, detailing application procedures, fees, deposit requirements, conditions for entry, and enforcement provisions.

items.name: right-way-patio-law-no-2023-230.md
items.title: Right of Way Patio (By-law No. 2023-230) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for the construction, operation, and maintenance of patios and parklets located on public rights-of-way, including definitions, permit requirements, application procedures, approval criteria, seasonal limitations, insurance requirements, general operating rules, specific regulations for different types of patios and parklets, smoking restrictions, permit modification and revocation procedures, enforcement measures, and associated fees.

items.name: road-activity-law-no-2003-445.md
items.title: Road Activity (By-law No. 2003-445) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law regulates activities on public highways, including road cuts and temporary construction-related encroachments, requiring permits, insurance, security, adherence to standards for reinstatement and traffic control, and outlining procedures for emergencies, inspections, orders, and penalties, with associated fees detailed in a schedule.

items.name: sewer-connection-law-no-2003-513.md
items.title: Sewer Connection (By-law No. 2003-513) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for connecting to and maintaining public and private sewage works, including definitions of relevant terms, general provisions for accessing and using sewage works, requirements for obtaining permits for connections and alterations, standards for design and construction, procedures for inspection and notification, responsibilities for care and maintenance, rules for blanking and reusing sewers, applicable frontage and capital charges, and penalties for offenses.

items.name: sewer-use-law-no-2003-514.md
items.title: Sewer Use (By-law No. 2003-514) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for controlling discharges into sewers and sewage works, including definitions of terms, application of the rules, requirements and prohibitions for sanitary, combined, and storm sewers, restrictions on dilution, regulations for transported liquid waste, reporting and monitoring obligations, provisions for agreements and compliance programs, sampling and analysis procedures, spill response protocols, requirements for manholes and monitoring devices, mandates for interceptors and amalgam separators, prohibitions on garbage grinders and certain swimming pool discharges, rights of entry for inspection, protection of sewage works from damage, penalties for offenses, repeal of previous regulations, transition provisions, and an effective date, along with tables detailing limits for various parameters in sanitary, combined, and storm sewer discharges and a schedule of fees.

items.name: shopping-cart-law-no-2013-252.md
items.title: Shopping Cart (By-law No. 2013-252) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law regulates shopping carts on public roads and property, prohibiting their removal from business premises and use off-site, requiring owners to implement management systems and label carts, and outlining procedures for removal, impounding, storage fees, retrieval, and disposal of carts found in violation.

items.name: short-term-borrowing-law-no-2019-268.md
items.title: Short Term Borrowing (By-law No. 2019-268) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines the authorization for temporary borrowing to cover current expenditures until revenues are received, setting limits on the borrowing amount based on estimated revenues and providing details on interest, loan agreements, and repayment.

items.name: short-term-rental-law-no-2021-104.md
items.title: Short-Term Rental (By-law No. 2021-104) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for short-term rentals, including requirements for hosts, property managers, and platforms to obtain permits or register, maintain insurance, provide guest information, adhere to occupancy limits and fire safety standards, and comply with data reporting and tax collection obligations, with provisions for enforcement, penalties, and appeals.

items.name: signs-city-roads-law-no-2003-520.md
items.title: Signs on City Roads (By-law No. 2003-520) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for placing signs and advertising devices on public roads, including definitions for various sign types and locations, general rules for placement, specific provisions for different sign categories like accessory signs, election signs, banners, and special event signs, requirements for sign systems such as community identification and directional farm signs, rules for specific areas like Confederation Boulevard, enforcement procedures including removal and fees, liability, penalties for contravention, and the relationship with other relevant regulations.

items.name: site-alteration-law-no-2024-448.md
items.title: Site Alteration (By-law No. 2024-448) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law regulates site alteration activities to protect agricultural resources, natural heritage features, and prevent drainage issues and public nuisances, outlining definitions, permitted and prohibited activities, enforcement procedures, and penalties.

items.name: site-plan-control-law-no-2014-256.md
items.title: Site Plan Control (By-law No. 2014 - 256) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document designates the entire territorial area as a site plan control area, requiring development approval unless specifically exempted, and outlines definitions, exemptions for various classes of development based on factors like building type, size, location, and use, conditions under which exemptions apply or are waived, provisions for replacing or rebuilding damaged structures, requirements for submitted plans and drawings, provisions for liens, the option of a letter of undertaking instead of a site plan agreement under certain conditions, and repeals a previous by-law.

items.name: small-business-tax-subclass-law-no-2021-343.md
items.title: Small Business Tax Subclass (By-law No. 2021-343) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document establishes a Small Business Tax Class for eligible commercial and industrial properties under a certain size, outlining the criteria for inclusion, the process for determining eligibility, procedures for audits and removal from the subclass, and the process for reconsideration and appeals of determinations, with specific roles assigned to a Program Administrator and an Appellate Authority.

items.name: smoking-and-vaping-law-no-2019-241.md
items.title: Smoking and Vaping (By-law No. 2019-241) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law prohibits smoking and vaping of tobacco, cannabis, and any other substance in public places and workplaces, defining terms like "ashtray," "By-law Officer," "cannabis," "electronic cigarette," "employer," "enclosed public place," "enclosed workplace," "outdoor municipal property," "outdoor restaurant or bar patio," "park," "property owner," "proprietor or other person in charge," "roof," "smoke" or "smoking," "smoking product," "vape" or "vaping," and "water pipe," and designates specific locations where smoking and vaping are prohibited, including outdoor municipal property, outdoor restaurant or bar patios, enclosed public places, enclosed workplaces, ByWard Market stands, Parkdale Market stands, Raymond Chabot Grant Thornton Park, and TD Place Stadium, while also prohibiting employers, proprietors, property owners, or other persons in charge from permitting smoking or vaping, displaying water pipes with smoking products, residue, charcoal, or liquid, or placing ashtrays in prohibited areas, requiring the posting of signs indicating the prohibition of smoking and vaping, establishing that contravening the by-law or hindering enforcement is an offence with potential fines and court orders, outlining enforcement by By-law Officers or the Chief of Police, and repealing previous by-laws related to smoking and water pipe use in public places and workplaces, as well as specific provisions in market and park by-laws, with the by-law coming into effect on November 1, 2019, and being cited as the "Smoking and Vaping By-law."

items.name: solid-waste-services-law-no-2024-453.md
items.title: Solid Waste Services (By-law No. 2024 - 453) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the regulations and procedures for solid waste management, including collection services for residential, multi-residential, and eligible industrial, commercial, and institutional properties, as well as the operation and use of the Trail Waste Facility, specifying acceptable and non-collectable waste materials, collection schedules, fees, and enforcement provisions.

items.name: special-events-city-streets-law-no-2001-260.md
items.title: Special Events on City Streets (By-law No. 2001-260) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law regulates special events on streets, requiring a permit from the General Manager, outlining application procedures, conditions, enforcement, and penalties.

items.name: special-events-public-and-private-property-law-no-2013-232.md
items.title: Special Events on Public and Private Property (By-law No. 2013-232) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the regulations, permitting process, conditions, and fees for holding special events on public and private property, including application requirements, exemptions, conditions for issuance, permit details, appeal procedures, permit modification or revocation, indemnification and insurance requirements, general administrative and regulatory provisions, inspection procedures, responsibility for actions of employees or assistants, review of permit holder's records, offences and penalties, representation, enforcement, and specific regulations and fees for beach events, paramedic services, fire services, public works services, police services, and by-law enforcement.

items.name: temporary-signs-private-property-law-no-2004-239.md
items.title: Temporary Signs on Private Property (By-law No. 2004-239) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for temporary signs on private property, including permit requirements, prohibited locations and types of signs, size and height restrictions, and rules for specific sign types like election, real estate, and inflatable signs, as well as procedures for sign removal and penalties for non-compliance.

items.name: traffic-and-parking-law-no-2017-301.md
items.title: Traffic and Parking (By-law No. 2017-301) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for traffic and parking on highways, including definitions, interpretation, time standards, rules for signs and traffic control devices, parking and stopping, zones, traffic movement, controlled-access roads, speed limits, heavy traffic, driving rules, pedestrians, bicycles, penalties, application, administration, parking on private and municipal property, parking for persons with disabilities, and procedures for reporting parking and traffic issues.

items.name: traffic-and-parking-law-no-2017-301%2Fadministration.md
items.title: Administration | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text defines terms related to vehicles, parking, traffic control, and areas within a highway for the purpose of regulating traffic and parking.

items.name: traffic-and-parking-law-no-2017-301%2Fpart-b-parking-private-property-and-city-property.md
items.title: Part B - Parking - Private property and city property | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations regarding parking on both private and public property, defining terms like "owner" and "occupant," establishing liability for parking violations, detailing conditions under which vehicles can be removed and impounded, specifying rules for parking in parks including designated areas, time limits, and payment requirements, prohibiting parking in restricted or reserved areas on public property, and outlining penalties for contraventions and the process for vehicle removal from public property.

items.name: traffic-and-parking-law-no-2017-301%2Fpart-c-parking-required-persons-disabilities.md
items.title: Part C - Parking required for persons with disabilities | City of Ottawa
items.summary: Regulations for accessible parking facilities require obligated organizations to comply with provincial accessibility standards, provide specific types and numbers of accessible parking spaces based on lot size, adhere to detailed design and layout specifications for these spaces including size, surface, slope, access aisles, and vertical clearance, ensure clear signage and pavement markings using the International Symbol of Accessibility, use authorized signs compliant with provincial regulations, maintain these signs, charge persons with disabilities no more than the standard parking fee, prohibit unauthorized parking in designated accessible spaces and misuse of accessible parking permits, maintain unobstructed access to accessible spaces, and outlines offenses and penalties for non-compliance.

items.name: traffic-and-parking-law-no-2017-301%2Fpart-d-parking-municipal-parking-lots.md
items.title: Part D - Parking on municipal parking lots | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text outlines regulations for parking on municipal parking lots, including definitions of terms, liability for violations, rules for parking within designated spaces, at electric vehicle charging stations, and to avoid obstruction, prohibitions on parking in signed areas, requirements for payment based on lot type, rules for using payment devices, and penalties for violations including fines and vehicle impoundment.

items.name: traffic-and-parking-law-no-2017-301%2Fpart-rules-road.md
items.title: Part A - Rules of the road | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines comprehensive regulations for traffic control, parking, and vehicle movement, including the authority to erect signs and signals, general parking and stopping rules, specific prohibitions with and without signs, regulations for various zones (loading, bus, taxi, accessible, etc.), rules for paid parking and payment devices, restrictions on heavy vehicles and loads, regulations for controlled-access roads, speed limits, rules for emerging from lanes, barricaded highways, coasting, traffic control at fires and collisions, racing, obstructing traffic, emergency regulations, funeral and other processions, vehicles crossing sidewalks and boulevards, boarding and alighting from moving vehicles, obedience to authorities and signs, exemptions for municipal and emergency vehicles, accessible parking permit usage and exemptions, pedestrian rules including yielding, prohibited areas, barriers, playing on roadways, and crossing restrictions, regulations for pedestrian malls, bicycle rules, prohibitions on bicycles, motor-assisted bicycles, and animals, rules regarding signs and their defacement, regulations for freshly painted lines, penalties for offences, vehicle removal for illegal parking, owner liability, enforcement responsibilities, the application of the regulations, conditions for accessible parking permit use, and the overarching authority of the Highway Traffic Act.

items.name: transit-law-no-2007-268.md
items.title: Transit (By-law No. 2007-268) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for public transit, including definitions of terms, rules for operating passenger transportation systems, fare collection and usage requirements, conduct on transit property and vehicles, operation of vehicles on transitways and O-Train facilities, and rules for Park and Ride lots.

items.name: tree-protection-law-no-2020-340.md
items.title: Tree Protection (By-law No. 2020-340) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for protecting municipal trees, municipal natural areas, and trees on private property in the urban area, including requirements for permits, tree conservation reports, tree protection measures, compensation for tree removal, and enforcement provisions.

items.name: use-and-care-roads-law-no-2003-498.md
items.title: Use and Care of Roads (By-law No. 2003-498) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for the use and maintenance of roads, including definitions of related terms, general prohibitions on activities like depositing substances, obstructing drains, and damaging infrastructure, exemptions for certain activities and individuals, requirements for property owners regarding boulevard maintenance, specific rules for boulevard gardens, free library boxes, and pop-up retail displays, regulations concerning highway signs and lighting, powers of the General Manager to remove unauthorized items and temporarily close highways, provisions for highway cleaning and repair, administration and enforcement details, penalties for contravention, repeal of previous regulations, and a list of prohibited plant species in the right of way.

items.name: vacant-property-law-no-2022-197.md
items.title: Vacant Property (By-law No. 2022-197) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This by-law outlines the requirements for permitting and regulating vacant buildings and lands, including definitions, exemptions, application procedures, permit conditions, inspections, enforcement, and penalties.

items.name: vacant-unit-tax-law-no-2022-135.md
items.title: Vacant Unit Tax (By-law No. 2022-135) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document establishes a tax on vacant residential properties, outlining definitions, conditions for vacancy, tax rates, payment procedures, exemptions, declaration requirements, enforcement mechanisms including audits and inspections, penalties for non-compliance, and processes for complaints and reviews.

items.name: vehicle-hire-law-no-2016-272.md
items.title: Vehicle For Hire (By-law No. 2016-272) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines the regulations, licensing requirements, and operational standards for vehicles-for-hire, including taxicabs, limousines, and Private Transportation Companies, covering driver and vehicle licensing, insurance, inspections, accessible services, fare structures, and enforcement procedures.

items.name: voluntary-admail-reduction-program-law-no-2003-493.md
items.title: Voluntary Admail Reduction Program (By-law No. 2003-493) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This program allows property owners to opt out of receiving unaddressed advertising material by displaying a purchased sticker, which prohibits distributors from delivering such material to properties with the sticker, although exceptions exist for paid newspapers, community newspapers, election campaign materials, and government information circulars, with delivery restrictions on location and time for properties without the sticker.

items.name: ward-boundaries-and-council-composition-law-no-2021-3.md
items.title: Ward Boundaries and Council Composition (By-law No. 2021-3) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document establishes new ward boundaries and council composition, repealing previous regulations, based on a review and an Ontario Land Tribunal order, with some amendments taking effect in 2026, and outlines the 24 wards and the composition of council including the mayor and one member elected per ward.

items.name: ward-boundaries-wards-6-9-11-13-21-24-law-no-2025-5.md
items.title: Ward Boundaries of Wards 6, 9, 11, 13, 21, 24 (By-law No. 2025-5) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text details amendments to existing ward boundaries, specifically for Wards 6, 9, 11, 13, 21, and 24, incorporating land redistribution as outlined in attached schedules, with these changes becoming effective on November 15, 2026.

items.name: water-law-no-2019-74.md
items.title: Water (By-law No. 2019-74) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines regulations for the municipal water supply, including definitions, responsibilities of city departments, conditions of service, permits, design and installation standards, backflow prevention, inspection, maintenance, access, water conservation, refusal of service, offenses, rates and charges, estimation of consumption, wastewater service rates, wastewater variable rate exemptions, payment procedures, mandatory and optional connection areas, well plugging, ground source heat pump systems, general provisions, enforcement, offenses, penalties, repeal of a previous by-law, and effective dates, along with detailed fee schedules and maps of designated areas.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250.md
items.title: Zoning (By-law No. 2008-250) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This text provides information on zoning regulations, including the Zoning By-law, Minister's Zoning Orders, how to interpret zone codes, exceptions, rural and greenbelt zoning, how the by-law consolidation is updated, and non-conforming rights.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation.md
items.title: Zoning By-law 2008-250 Consolidation | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document provides a consolidated version of the Zoning By-law, current to November 24, 2023, for reference purposes, outlining administrative details, general and specific use provisions, parking and loading regulations, residential provisions, and descriptions of various residential, institutional, open space, environmental, mixed-use/commercial, industrial, transportation, rural, and development reserve zones, along with appendices, schedules, zoning maps, and Section 37 provisions, while advising readers to consult the official By-law and amending by-laws for legal accuracy and providing contact information for Development Information Officers.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions.md
items.title: Part 15 - Exceptions | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text describes how to confirm zoning provisions by contacting development information officers via 311, and lists numerous exceptions to standard provisions, categorized numerically and with an 'r' suffix.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions.md
items.title: Rural Exceptions | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text describes how specific exceptions, indicated by bracketed numbers on Zoning Maps, modify general zoning provisions, with these exceptions taking precedence over other rules, and clarifies that for standards or restrictions based on the number of dwelling units, a detached dwelling containing an oversize dwelling unit is counted as a single dwelling unit.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-101r-200r.md
items.title: Exceptions 101r-200r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines a series of exceptions to land use regulations across various zones, detailing specific provisions for additional permitted uses, prohibited uses, and general provisions, with many entries indicating that all uses are permitted except for certain unlisted exceptions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1r-100r.md
items.title: Exceptions 1r-100r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines a series of exceptions, identified by number, that apply to various zones, detailing additional land uses permitted, land uses prohibited, and other provisions within those zones.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-201r-300r.md
items.title: Exceptions 201r-300r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines various land use exceptions across different zones, detailing permitted additional uses, prohibited uses, and specific provisions, with many entries indicating "all uses except for" or "conditional uses."

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-301r-400r.md
items.title: Exceptions 301r-400r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various land use exceptions, detailing specific exception numbers, applicable zones, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other relevant provisions, with some entries reserved for future use or referencing OMB decisions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-401r-500r.md
items.title: Exceptions 401r-500r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines various exceptions to zoning regulations, specifying permitted and prohibited land uses across different zones, with many entries indicating "all uses except" for certain categories or specific exclusions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-501r-600r.md
items.title: Exceptions 501r-600r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a comprehensive list of exceptions to zoning regulations, detailing specific exception numbers, the applicable zones, and provisions for additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other general provisions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-601r-700r.md
items.title: Exceptions 601r-700r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document details a series of land use exceptions, categorized by exception number and applicable zones, specifying additional permitted uses, prohibited uses, and general provisions for each exception.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-701r-800r.md
items.title: Exceptions 701r-800r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The provided tables list various exception numbers, their corresponding applicable zones, and columns for additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and general provisions, with most of the latter three columns currently blank or indicating "all uses except" for specific RC zones.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-801r-900r.md
items.title: Exceptions 801r-900r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines a series of exceptions to zoning regulations, detailing specific applicable zones, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other provisions, with many entries reserved for future use or indicating that all uses are permitted except for certain specified ones.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Frural-exceptions%2Fexceptions-901r-1000r.md
items.title: Exceptions 901r-1000r | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document details various land use exceptions, specifying permitted and prohibited uses, as well as unique provisions for different zones, including setbacks, lot dimensions, coverage, building heights, and conditions for lifting "holding" symbols, which often require satisfactory completion of site plan approvals, servicing demonstrations, or risk assessments.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions.md
items.title: Urban Exceptions | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text details how specific exceptions, identified by numbers and marked on Zoning Maps, modify general provisions for certain lands, with these exceptions taking precedence over other rules, and clarifies that for the purpose of applying standards or restrictions based on dwelling units, an oversize dwelling unit within a detached dwelling is counted as a single dwelling unit.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1-100.md
items.title: Exceptions 1-100 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The provided text outlines various land use exceptions, detailing applicable zones, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and specific provisions, often including height (H) and floor space ratio (F) limits, and references to schedules (S).

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1001-1100.md
items.title: Exceptions 1001-1100 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text lists various exception numbers and their corresponding applicable zones, with columns for additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and general provisions, though most of these columns are currently empty.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-101-200.md
items.title: Exceptions 101-200 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a table of exceptions, detailing specific provisions for various zones, including permitted and prohibited land uses, and other relevant conditions, identified by unique exception numbers.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1101-1200.md
items.title: Exceptions 1101-1200 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document lists zoning exceptions, detailing exception numbers, applicable zones, and specific provisions regarding permitted or prohibited land uses, including height restrictions and yard requirements, with some entries reserved for future use.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1201-1300.md
items.title: Exceptions 1201-1300 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various land use exceptions, detailing specific exception numbers, the applicable zoning categories, and provisions for additional permitted or prohibited land uses, with some entries noting specific dwelling types or non-residential use restrictions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1301-1400.md
items.title: Exceptions 1301-1400 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document details a series of exceptions to zoning regulations, listing specific exception numbers, the applicable zones, any additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other relevant provisions, including references to official orders.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1401-1500.md
items.title: Exceptions 1401-1500 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document lists numerous zoning exceptions, identified by an exception number and an applicable zone (e.g., R3Z[1401], O1[1402], GM1[1404]), with some entries specifying height or floor space index, and occasionally noting additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, or other provisions, including references to OMB Orders or Decisions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1501-1600.md
items.title: Exceptions 1501-1600 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The provided text is a list of exception numbers, applicable zones, and provisions for land use, detailing permitted and prohibited uses, and other specific conditions, including references to an OMB decision and various subsections.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1601-1700.md
items.title: Exceptions 1601-1700 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines a series of exceptions to zoning regulations, categorized by exception number and applicable zones, with columns for additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and general provisions, although most entries currently lack specific details in the latter three categories.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1701-1800.md
items.title: Exceptions 1701-1800 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The provided tables detail exceptions to zoning regulations, listing exception numbers, applicable zones (e.g., R3Z, IG5, LC6), and specific provisions which may include additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, or other stipulations such as area limitations for certain ground floor uses (e.g., AM[1711]S248, 249 limiting ground floor uses to 500 sq. m. per building) or general prohibitions (e.g., GM[1720]H(14) and GM[1738]H(13.5) listing all uses except or all uses prohibited except for certain conditions).

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1801-1900.md
items.title: Exceptions 1801-1900 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines a series of land use exceptions, detailing applicable zones, permitted additional land uses, prohibited land uses, and specific provisions for each exception number.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-1901-2000.md
items.title: Exceptions 1901-2000 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various exceptions to zoning regulations, detailing specific exception numbers, applicable zones, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and general provisions, with many entries reserving future use or specifying that full zone provisions apply unless otherwise stated within the exception.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2001-2100.md
items.title: Exceptions 2001-2100 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various land use exceptions, detailing specific provisions, permitted and prohibited land uses, and applicable zones, with some entries reserving future use or referencing compliance with the Planning Act for development height and density.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-201-300.md
items.title: Exceptions 201-300 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various land use exceptions, categorized by exception number and applicable zones, detailing additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and specific provisions for each exception.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2101-2200.md
items.title: Exceptions 2101-2200 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various land use exceptions, detailing applicable zones, permitted and prohibited additional land uses, and specific provisions for each exception number.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2201-2300.md
items.title: Exceptions 2201-2300 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines a series of exceptions, identified by unique numbers (e.g., AM10[2201], TM[2214], R5K[2219]), that specify applicable zones (e.g., H(15), R4E, F(1.0)), detail additional permitted land uses (e.g., "All uses except:", "All uses in subsection 205(1) except:"), list prohibited land uses, and include general provisions, with some entries reserved for future use.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2301-2400.md
items.title: Exceptions 2301-2400 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines a series of exceptions to zoning regulations, detailing specific exception numbers, the applicable zones, any additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other relevant provisions, with several entries reserved for future use.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2401-2500.md
items.title: Exceptions 2401-2500 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document lists numerous exceptions to zoning regulations, identified by unique exception numbers and applicable zones, with some exceptions specifying additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, or other specific provisions, such as temporary parking lot allowances, rules for back-to-back townhouses, and provisions for buildings over 15 meters.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2501-2600.md
items.title: Exceptions 2501-2600 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a table of exceptions to zoning regulations, detailing exception numbers, applicable zones, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other relevant provisions, with many entries reserved for future use or specifying general commercial use exceptions.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2601-2700.md
items.title: Exceptions 2601-2700 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various zoning exceptions, identified by unique exception numbers and applicable zones, with some entries specifying additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, or particular provisions, including details on amenity area requirements, parking regulations, and conditions related to the Planning Act.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2701-2800.md
items.title: Exceptions 2701 - 2800 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text outlines various zoning exceptions and provisions, detailing permitted and prohibited land uses, as well as specific development standards such as setbacks, lot areas, building heights, and conditions related to Section 37 of the Planning Act for different residential, commercial, and industrial zones.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-2801-2900.md
items.title: Exceptions 2801 - 2900 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines specific exceptions to zoning regulations, categorized by exception number, applicable zone, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other provisions, with many entries reserving future use or detailing specific conditions for development, such as building setbacks, heights, and amenity area allowances.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-301-400.md
items.title: Exceptions 301-400 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various exception provisions related to land uses, categorized by applicable zones, additional permitted uses, prohibited uses, and other specific provisions, with each exception identified by a unique number.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-401-500.md
items.title: Exceptions 401-500 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various exceptions to zoning regulations, categorized by exception number, applicable zone, additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and general provisions.

items.title: Exceptions 501-600 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines a series of zoning exceptions, identified by unique exception numbers and applicable zones, detailing specific provisions for additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other general provisions, with some entries noting references to external orders or specific standards like lot width, area, and setback for certain dwelling types.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-601-700.md
items.title: Exceptions 601-700 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a table of exceptions, detailing specific provisions, permitted and prohibited land uses, and other conditions for various applicable zones, identified by unique exception numbers.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-701-800.md
items.title: Exceptions 701-800 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document outlines various zoning exceptions, primarily focusing on residential zones, with specific provisions for rear yard setbacks abutting certain roads and general rules regarding yard encroachments for porches, eaves, and pilasters.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-801-900.md
items.title: Exceptions 801-900 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: The text is a list of exception numbers and their corresponding applicable zones, with columns for additional permitted land uses, prohibited land uses, and other provisions, though these latter columns are currently empty.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-15-exceptions%2Furban-exceptions%2Fexceptions-901-1000.md
items.title: Exceptions 901-1000 | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document is a table of zoning exceptions, detailing specific exception numbers, applicable zones, and provisions for additional or prohibited land uses, with some entries reserved for future use.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-16-appendix-b%2Fappendix-b-amendment-schedule-zoning-law-and-interim-control-laws-law-no-2022-232.md
items.title: Appendix B - Amendment Schedule to the Zoning By-law and Interim Control By-laws (By-law No. 2022-232) | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This appendix provides a regularly updated, descending numerical list of amending by-laws to the Zoning By-law, detailing affected lands, enactment dates with links to council meeting agendas and minutes (including related reports and disposition), and the current status of each amendment, with copies available at the Client Service Centre and Archives, noting that this appendix is for reference only and amendments are incorporated into the main by-law text, schedules, and map only upon full force and effect after any appeal period or tribunal decision.

items.name: zoning-law-no-2008-250%2Fzoning-law-2008-250-consolidation%2Fpart-17-schedules.md
items.title: Part 17 - Schedules | City of Ottawa
items.summary: This document provides a list of schedules, which are area-specific or site-specific illustrations of zoning provisions, for various locations and regulations including central, inner urban, suburban, and rural areas, minimum parking requirements, rapid-transit stations, arterial and major collector roads, wards, the international airport, the Byward Market, rural villages, irregularly shaped lots, downtown building height restrictions and maximum heights, and specific properties and blocks.
